spMisc | R package
  • Reference

[+] Simulate correlated continuous data from standard normal distribution

Simulate correlated continuaous data from standard normal distribution by using Choleski factorization of correlation matrix.

simCorrVars(corrMat, N = 100)

Arguments

corrMat

A symmetricmatrix of correlation coefficients. Determinant of corrMat must be positive. If corrMat is a vector, it is passed to function corr_vec2mat to construct a correlation matrix. Default corrMat = corr_vec2mat(c(.8,.2,.7)).
N

A number of observations. Default is 100.

Source

http://www.r-bloggers.com/simulating-random-multivariate-correlated-data-continuous-variables/

Value

A dataframe with correlated variables.

Details

Number of variables is determined by the size of correlation matrix corrMat.

See also

corr_vec2mat, mvrnorm, chol

Other simmulation functions in spMisc: corr_vec2mat

Examples


# ------------------------------------------------------------
simCorrVars()
#>               V1          V2           V3

# ------------------------------------------------------------
# Generate 2 correlated variables with 10 observations:
# A. Imput is a matrix

corrMat <- matrix(c(1, .5, .5, 1), 2)
print(corrMat)
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  1.0  0.5
#> [2,]  0.5  1.0
simCorrVars(corrMat, N = 10)
#>             V1         V2
#> 1   1.05215542 -1.1882673
#> 2   1.20838561  0.4575919
#> 3   0.29502975  1.2441980
#> 4  -1.13534326 -1.5471930
#> 5   0.10999338  0.7936344
#> 6  -0.23433786  1.6899564
#> 7  -0.11091937 -1.2617006
#> 8  -1.14229077  0.9050891
#> 9  -0.08007363 -0.4187335
#> 10 -0.11921509  0.6214893

# B. Imput is a vector
simCorrVars(.5, N = 10)
#>            V1         V2
#> 1  -0.5789452 -0.4154160
#> 2   0.5264580  1.7645517
#> 3   1.4486572  2.0391224
#> 4  -0.3840073  1.3903332
#> 5  -0.5514917 -1.0255104
#> 6  -0.3438315  0.7485623
#> 7   0.8130582  1.9683915
#> 8  -0.1050687  0.7982952
#> 9  -1.7133026 -1.5772014
#> 10  1.1004919  0.3997133
simCorrVars(c(.1,.5,.8), N = 10)
#>              V1           V2         V3
#> 1   0.178812018 -0.677047326 -0.8465919
#> 2  -0.975423042 -0.434421671 -0.2515607
